intro: Pouzolzia pentandra var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and sometimes edible parts. The plant features slender, ascending stems with alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
